document_data.name: Mulani
document_data.mainbody: The '''Mulani languages group''' was one of the two major branches of the [[Rauric languages]] family and included languages spoken in [[East Faerûn]] by the [[Mulan]] people.{{Cite dragon annual/1999/Speaking in Tongues|29}}<ref group="note">In 3{{rd}} edition, all of the Mulani languages are grouped together under [[Mulhorandi language|Mulhorandi]]. This article attributes information provided about that language in later sources to the Mulani group as a whole, as the history of the people groups speaking these languages are also clearly outlined.
document_data.Subgroups: The Mulani languages were further subdivided into the [[Mulhorandi languages|Mulhorandi]] and [[Muhjuri]] branches.
document_data.History: The Mulani languages derived in part from a slave argot of one or more of the [[Imaskari languages]]. Over the millennia, the Mulani tongues remained more similar to their Rauric roots than did the [[Untheric languages]].
